meanings.definition: To emphasize or make more noticeable.
meanings.sent1: Her bright red dress accentuated her happiness at the party.
meanings.sent2: The artist accentuated the shadows in his painting to create depth.
meanings.sent3: The clown accentuated his big shoes with even bigger bows.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room accentuated the ticking of the clock.
meanings.sent5: The chef accentuated the flavors in the dish with a hint of fresh herbs.

meanings.definition: To highlight or bring attention to.
meanings.sent1: The neon sign accentuated the entrance to the club.
meanings.sent2: The speaker accentuated the importance of voting in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: The detective accentuated the key evidence with a dramatic reenactment.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight accentuated the beauty of the garden at night.
meanings.sent5: The teacher accentuated the main points of the lesson with colorful visuals.

meanings.definition: To intensify or make more pronounced.
meanings.sent1: The storm accentuated the howling of the wind outside.
meanings.sent2: The use of bold font accentuated the title on the poster.
meanings.sent3: The magician accentuated his trick with a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of fresh coffee accentuated the cozy atmosphere of the cafe.
meanings.sent5: The athlete accentuated her speed with a burst of energy at the finish line.
